Linus and Luke discuss a new study showing that “adversarial poetry” can reliably bypass AI safety guardrails. They break down how major models responded, why creative writing can outperform technical exploits, and what this means for the future of AI safety.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35igp1OBRY0

title: Weaponized Poetry is a Thing

Linus and Luke discuss Apple’s surprising shift toward more reasonable memory and storage upgrade pricing amid today’s inflated DRAM market. They compare real-world component prices, debate whether the trend will last, and unpack how Black Friday deals and the AI-driven memory surge distort what “fair pricing” even means.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35igp1OBRY0

title: Apple's Prices Are Less Outrageous Now.

Linus and Luke discuss why Americans are holding onto phones longer than ever, questioning claims about lost productivity and pointing out how modern devices stay usable far beyond old upgrade cycles. They dive into real-world longevity examples, the shrinking appeal of new features, and how repair, support, and changing tech habits shape today’s slow upgrade culture.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35igp1OBRY0
